resources.string: Enable notification when an USB storage is pluged.
Chose what shortcut should be created on the notification bar when an USB storage is pluged.

string-array.name: notification_type_array
string-array.item: Create a notification shortcut to default Storage Settings application when an USB storage is pluged.
Create a quick unmount/mount shortcut for available storage devices. (Check first choice if you encounter with errors)

resources.string: Choose what paths should not be (un)mount.
Select a file manager to be launched when a storage is mounted.
Use this to show or hide the notification shortcuts.
By checking this you will enable debugging support. You will see some toast messages on the screen with device events. In format: Storage Info: android.intent…
Seems you have a customized Android version:\n%s
Mount the storage on the path: \"%s\".
Path: \"%s\"\nIf you unmount the USB storage, some applications that you are using will stop and may be unavailable until you remount the storage.
Cannot unmount USB storage with the path: \"%s\".\nTry again later.\nIf the error persist please uncheck the quick storage access.

Cannot unmount storage with the path: "%1$s".
Try again later.
If the error persist please uncheck the quick storage access.
The error:
%2$s.
The cause:
%3$s.
Cannot mount storage with the path: \"%s\".\nTry to detach and attach again your device.

Cannot mount storage. Try again later.
If the error persist please uncheck the quick storage access.
The error:
%1$s.
The cause:
%2$s.

The Android version from this device do not provide an access to default Storage Settings activity: \"%s\".\nThis is not a normal exception and is related only with the Android version from this device. Most probably is a custom ROM or the developers do not respect Google requirements: http://developer.android.com/reference/android/provider/Settings.html#ACTION_INTERNAL_STORAGE_SETTINGS
Only if you want to appreciate my work.

If you appreciate this application, please do a donation buying Storage Info PRO!\nPressing YES button, you will be sent to Storage Info PRO from Google Play Store.\nThank you for using this application!
Thank you for the appreciation of my work, buying pro application.

string.name: about_text
string.Data:
Because my phone have support for USB-OTG (USB On-The-Go), but do not have a quick way to unmount an attached USB device, I made this application.
This is an open source application. The sources are available here: https://code.google.com/p/storage-info/

This application will create a shortcut to access the Storage Settings from the Notification bar when an USB mass storage is connected to an Android device which support USB-OTG.
Normaly the Storage Settings should be accessbile from your Settings menu.

Starting with the version 2.0 is possible to access a quick mounting and unmounting dialog from the Notification bar.
If this new feature is crashing, please unplug any USB device attached and uncheck the "Enable quick storage access.".

This application will not add to your device host support, read device manual to see if the device support USB-OTG. In some cases the USB-OTG could be enabled by using a custom ROM.

This application will not always mount back an unmounted USB storage device, that\'s because sometime the Android system is not able to process that request. I made the implementation but is not always successfully.

Starting with the version 3.0 is possible to select an application, preferable a file manager, to be launched when a storage is mounted.
If you select a file manager to be launched when a storage is mounted is no guarentee to be displayed the mounted folder, that because is not a standard way to \"notice\" the application to show a particular path. I test with ES File Explorer.
